item.title: Linux EXT4 Filesystem showing impressive speeds
item.description: ZDNet: "More and more articles have been appearing on the EXT4 filesystem. In fact, the article that really caught my eye was one recently regarding the speed of using EXT4 on flash media."

item.title: Parted Magic review
item.description: Linux User and Developer: "Parted Magic is one of the best standalone partition management Linux solutions out there. Sukrit explains why"

item.title: Generating barcodes with KBarcode
item.description: Worldlabel: "Sometimes alphanumeric text simply won't cut it, and you need a bar code — mailing labels, security badges, inventory tracking, perhaps even URL-encoding for mobile phones."

item.title: Linux Embeds Itself Even Deeper
item.description: Open Enterprise: "Because anyone can take Linux and use it as they wish without needing to ask permission (provided they comply with the licence), it ends up being used in lots of places that we rarely hear about."

item.title: How did we learn to use our computers?
item.description: Technology & Life Integration: "It is a common argument that Linux will never make it mainstream because everybody already knows windows. It has been said that because everybody knows windows that there is nobody to teach them Linux."

item.title: What's really going on with Ubuntu Unity
item.description: Cyber Cynic: "As Debian is to Ubuntu, so GNOME is to Unity. What do I mean by that? Well, once upon a time there was an operating system called Debian. It was, and is, a powerful version of Linux. Outside of the Linux community, though, almost no one had ever heard of it."

item.title: Lessons from PostgreSQL's Git transition
item.description: LWN.net: "The PostgreSQL Project finally switched from CVS to Git in September 2010, and did its first release based on the new Git repository on October 5. Making the switch happen took years and resulted in at least one near-disaster"

item.title: Blender 2.5 Lighting and Rendering
item.description: Packt: "Lighting techniques are highly dependent on the location of the scene at hand. The approaches to lighting an outdoor scene are radically different from the techniques used to light an indoor scene. Knowing these differences and when to use each is important when aiming for a believable result."

item.title: Top 10 tech tricks we're sick of seeing in movies
item.description: CNet: "But for every thrilling example of cool-ass tech, Hollywood seems to produce a tired, dated cliche. There's the obligatory no-cell-phone-service scene in horror flicks. There are robots with ATTITUDE in science fiction. There are impossible user interfaces in action films."

item.title: A Peek Into The X.Org Stack For Ubuntu 11.04
item.description: Phoronix: "The general X.Org planning summit for Ubuntu 11.04 just ended at the Ubuntu Developer Summit in Orlando. Here's a few key highlights from this hour-long discussion about the make-up of the X.Org / graphics stack for the Natty Narwhal release due for release in April. "

item.title: Day 11 in the SCO v. Novell Trial, Monday, March 22, 2010, Tibbitts, LaSala - as text
item.description: Groklaw: "The most important piece of all the Tibbitts testimony is when he testified that SCO needs the UNIX and UnixWare copyrights not only for the products business but for SCOsource. May I point out that this directly contradicts what SCO's CEO Darl McBride told the world in June 2003"

item.title: Gemalto Sues Google, HTC, Samsung Over Java Card Technology
item.description: Bloomberg: "Gemalto NV sued Google Inc. and phonemakers HTC Corp., Motorola Inc. and Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd., claiming the Android mobile-phone operating system used its technology without permission."

item.title: The 2011 IT Salary Guide
item.description: Datamation: "The good news: the The 2011 IT Salary Guide demonstrates that IT salary levels are once again headed upward."

item.title: Has Ubuntu exceeded the Ben & Jerry's hippie threshold?
item.description: ZDNet: "Canonical is coming to the realization that it needs to compromise some of its core values in order to make its Ubuntu Linux desktop successful."

item.title: How to configure LVM on Pardus 2011
item.description: LinuxBSDos: "This article presents a step by step guide on how to install Pardus 2011 on a custom LVM disk partitioning scheme. If LVM is the default disk partitioning scheme, why would it be necessary to create a custom configuration?"
